We really can’t be more grateful. This house was perfect and EXACTLY what we needed for our anniversary getaway. I don’t think I can complain about anything and the communication was spot on. Our usual anniversary spot was booked and so we had tried to find a dog friendly place that was close to hiking and was private/quiet. You house was immaculate, had plentiful kitchen amenities and dog supplies (dog blankets for the couch, poop bags, treats, bowls and towels to wipe paws!) as well as an enormous deck with gates on each end so we didn't have to worry about the dogs escaping! Nicole was wonderful at communication and promptly answered any questions we had as well as checking in to make sure we were having a perfect stay. I appreciated the guidebook she made about the area and things to do/places to eat and well written, clear instructions for checking out, including the option to leave any leftover kitchen supplies/food for the next guests so it wouldn't go to waste. (Normally, this might sketch me out but since it was clear that this wasn't just forgotten stuff, like condiments, I appreciated it!). The area was located about 15-20 minutes away from town down a beautiful country road and the leaves were all starting to change. Behind the house is the firepit which we didn't use but look very inviting and a nice size yard in front of the house and beside it. Our dogs loved to play ball and sniff all the new smells in the yard but also wander around on the deck watching the deer in the woods behind the house. We didn't see any cows in the nearby pastures but heard them and the coyotes at nighttime. My only suggestion is to check out hours for local spots like coffee shops, wineries and restaurants. We hit up Twisted Winery Saturday night and it was awesome with great wine and live music as well as several fire pits and heat lamps for the cold evening, but the other winery was closed at 6 and the following two days were there. No big deal as we spent the following day hiking but in a smaller town, definitely check hours. But that's really the only thing that isn't even negative, just a tip!
This house and hosts are definitely 5 plus stars and have set the bar high for future airbnbs we visit. Thank you again, you will NOT be disappointed if you book this house!

We had 6 people in our group, so two people had to bring chairs in from the dining room. I would recommend the host purchase two sitting chairs for the living room to serve the maximum amount of guests. The living room is spacious enough to accommodate the additional seating.
All in all, we enjoyed our stay and had a great time in the area. We are planning to return next year.
